member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfileCardDetails.CardId
member.summary: Paynova's unique identifier for the profile card stored within a customer profile. This id should be used for subsequent requests to Paynova involving profile card payments.

member.summary: The four-digit expiration year of the card.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfileCardDetails.ExpirationMonth
member.summary: The two-digit expiration month of the card.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfileCardDetails.FirstSix
member.summary: The first six digits of the card number (BIN/IIN).

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfileCardDetails.LastFour
member.summary: The last four digits of the card number.

member.name: T:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment
member.summary: Represents a segment of a travel . Use specific implementations and .

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.SegmentType
member.summary: The means of travel.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.DepartureDate
member.summary: The scheduled departure date for this segment, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2013-11-23

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.DepartureTime
member.summary: The scheduled departure time for this segment, in the format HH:MM, using the 24-hour time format. Example: 19:55

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.DepartureCountryCode
member.summary: The country in which the departure station/airport for this segment is in. This may be the two-letter (alpha-2), three-letter (alpha-3) code or the ISO country number as per ISO 3166-1. Example: SE, SWE, 752

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.ArrivalDate
member.summary: The scheduled arrival date for this segment, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2013-11-23

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.ArrivalTime
member.summary: The scheduled arrival time for this segment, in the format HH:MM, using the 24-hour time format. Example: 19:55

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.ArrivalCountryCode
member.summary: The country in which the destination station/airport for this segment is in. This may be the two-letter (alpha-2), three-letter (alpha-3) code or the ISO country number as per ISO 3166-1. Example: SE, SWE, 752

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.CarrierDesignator
member.summary:
The IATA or ICAO airline code, or the UIC railway code, of the carrier for this segment, in the format "authority:code". AIR Segments: If you were sending the code for Scandinavian Airlines (SAS), you would send: For IATA: "IATA:SK" For ICAO: "ICAO:SAS"
RAIL Segments: If you were sending the code for Swedish Railway (SJ), you would send: For UIC you would send: "UIC:1174"

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.TravelSegment.Tickets
member.summary: The tickets which were issued for this segment of travel.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.AirTravelSegment.DepartureAirportCode
member.summary: The IATA or ICAO airport or city code of the departure airport for this segment, in the format "authority:code". Example: for Arlanda airport in Stockholm, Sweden: For IATA you would send: "IATA:ARN" For ICAO you would send: "ICAO:ESSA"

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.AirTravelSegment.ArrivalAirportCode
member.summary: The IATA or ICAO airport or city code of the arrival airport for this segment, in the format "authority:code". Example: for Arlanda airport in Stockholm, Sweden: For IATA you would send: "IATA:ARN" For ICAO you would send: "ICAO:ESSA"

member.name: T:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Currency code entity. Should follow ISO 4217. http://docs.paynova.com

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.#ctor(Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceId,System.String,System.Uri,System.Uri,System.Uri)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The id of the web interface to use. Helpers exists, e.g: .
The three-letter language code identifying the language that the payment interface should be displayed to the customer in.
The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon successful payment.
The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon the customer cancelling payment or running out of payment attempts.

The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon a payment being in either an indeterminable or pending state. Payment methods which are not "real-time" (for example, Laschrift/ELV, Überweisung) use this status.

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.WithLayoutName(System.Func{Paynova.Api.Client.Model.LayoutNames,System.String})
member.summary: Sets and returns the current see for fluent config. Look at for some pre-defined values.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.InterfaceId
member.summary: The id of the web interface to use.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.DisplayLineItems
member.summary: Indicates whether or not order line-items should be displayed to the customer. The default is true if you send line items, false if you do not send line items.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.ThemeName
member.summary: The name of your custom hosted theme at Paynova. Note that this field only applies to merchants who have setup a custom theme with us and specifying an invalid value will result in your payment page not rendering properly.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.LayoutName
member.summary: The name of the layout to use. For assistance . Example: Paynova_FullPage_1, Paynova_Mobile_1

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.CustomerLanguageCode
member.summary: The three-letter language code identifying the language that the payment interface should be displayed to the customer in.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.UrlRedirectSuccess
member.summary: The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon successful payment.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.UrlRedirectCancel
member.summary: The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon the customer cancelling payment or running out of payment attempts.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.UrlRedirectPending
member.summary: The URL on your website to which we should redirect the customer upon a payment being in either an indeterminable or pending state. Payment methods which are not "real-time" (for example, Laschrift/ELV, Überweisung) use this status.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions.UrlCallback
member.summary: A URL to your system which we can send Event Hook Notifications (EHNs) to. If this parameter is provided, it will be used instead of any statically configured EHN URLs.

member.summary: Layout designed for desktop browsers.

member.summary: Layout designed for mobile browsers. Only card payments are supported.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfilePaymentOptions.ProfileId
member.summary: Your identifier for the customer profile.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfilePaymentOptions.ProfileCard
member.summary: The profile card use in the payment. If the payment is to be performed on a stored profile card, this parameter is required.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.ProfilePaymentOptions.DisplaySaveProfileCardOption
member.summary: If you would like the customer to choose whether or not to save their card in your customer profile on Paynova's page, then set this option to true.
member.remarks:
If you provide a profile id in profilePaymentOptions and this value is false, the card will be saved and the customer will not be presented with an option on Paynova's payment page.
If you provide a profile id in profilePaymentOptions and this value is not present (null), the card will be saved.
If you provide a profile id in profilePaymentOptions and this value is true, the customer will be presented with the option to choose whether or not they want their card saved on Paynova's payment page. If the customer opts to save their card, you will receive a profile card identifier after the payment has been completed (assuming the customer pays with a card), otherwise the card will not be saved to the customer's profile and you will not receive an identifier.

member.summary: Creates a with all necessary parameters.
member.param: The id for this line item. This value must be unique per collection of line items.
The article/product number for the item being sold.
The name/description of the item being sold.
The unit of measure of the product/service being sold. Examples: meters, pieces, st., ea.
The tax/VAT percentage for the item being sold. Example: 25
The number of items being sold at this price.
The price of each unit, excluding tax.
The total amount charged for this line, including tax/VAT (quantity * unitAmountExcludingTax + calculated tax).
The total tax/VAT amount charged for this line.

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.AnnulAuthorizationRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the request.
member.param: The unique id of the transaction (authorization) that you received from Paynova.
The total amount to annul. The amount must be equal to or less than the original authorized amount.

member.name: T:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest
member.summary: Represents the request used to create an order within Paynova's system. http://docs.paynova.com

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.#ctor(System.String,Paynova.Api.Client.Model.CurrencyCode,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates a request object used with to create an order within Paynova's system.
member.param: Your identifier for the order, most likely from your order management system.
The total amount of the order. If line items are provided, the value of this field must equal the total sum of all line items. For Japanese Yuan (JPY), only whole numbers are allowed.

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates a request object used with to create an order within Paynova's system.
member.param: Your identifier for the order, most likely from your order management system.
Example: SEK, 752
The total amount of the order. If line items are provided, the value of this field must equal the total sum of all line items. For Japanese Yuan (JPY), only whole numbers are allowed.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.OrderNumber
member.summary: Gets the provided identifier for the order. Most likely from your order management system.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.OrderDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary and optional description of the order. This information is stored on the transaction level.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.CurrencyCode
member.summary: Gets the three-letter (alpha-3) ISO currency code or currency number as per ISO 4217. Example: SEK, 752

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.TotalAmount
member.summary: Gets the total amount of the order. If line items are provided, the value of this field must equal the total sum of all line items.
member.remarks: For Japanese Yuan (JPY), only whole numbers are allowed.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.SalesChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets your reference for the sales channel through which the customer is purchasing goods/services.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.SalesLocationId
member.summary: Gets or sets your identifier for the sales location. This might be a website URL, a country, a call-center location, etc.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.Customer
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the customer.
member.remarks: Information contained within this parameter is required for certain payment methods, and if fraud screening is used.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.BillTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the billing name and address of the customer/company, generally the "invoice address" or "account holder" details.
member.remarks: Information contained within this parameter is required for certain payment methods, and if fraud screening is used.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.ShipTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the ship-to name and address of the recipient.
member.remarks: Information contained within this parameter is required for certain payment methods, and if fraud screening is used.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.CreateOrderRequest.LineItems
member.summary: Gets the line items included in this order (what the customer is paying for). You may include as many line items as required to specify the order.
member.remarks: It is highly recommended that you always send in complete line item information. Several payment methods, especially invoicing methods, require complete line information and you will not be able to use these methods if lines are not provided.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.CustomerId
member.summary: Your unique identifier for the customer.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.EmailAddress
member.summary: The customer's e-mail address.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.Name
member.summary: The name of the customer and/or company.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.HomeTelephone
member.summary: The customer's home telephone number including the national prefix. Example: +468 555 55 55

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.WorkTelephone
member.summary: The customer's work telephone number including the national prefix. Example: +468 555 55 55

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Model.Customer.MobileTelephone
member.summary: The customer's mobile telephone number including the national prefix. Example: +46722 55 55 55

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.FinalizeAuthorizationRequest.InvoiceId
member.summary: Gets or sets your identifier for the invoice. For invoice payment methods, this identifier will be printed on the invoice and is required.
member.remarks: To maximize compatibility with existing and payment methods which are added in the future, we recommend that you always send an invoice id, regardless of the payment method used to generate the authorization

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.GetCustomerProfileRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates request for getting a customer profile.
member.param: Your unique identifier for the customer profile stored at Paynova.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.GetCustomerProfileRequest.ProfileId
member.summary: Gets your unique identifier for the customer profile stored at Paynova.

member.name: T:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest
member.summary: Represents the request used to create a payment Session within Paynova's system. http://docs.paynova.com

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Decimal,Paynova.Api.Client.Model.PaymentChannelId,Paynova.Api.Client.Model.InterfaceOptions)
member.summary: Creates a request object used with to create a payment Session within Paynova's system.
member.param: The unique identifier (GUID) that you received from Paynova in the response from .

The total amount that should be processed for this payment. This must be equal to or less than the original order amount and less than the original order amount minus any payments which have been already made on the order. For the majority of implementors, this will always be equal to the original amount. Lesser amounts would typically only be used in the use case where multiple payments are being made on the same order.
The channel of payment. Using helper factory method on : PaymentChannelId.Web() Or if not yet added to helpers: new PaymentChannelId(1)
Used to configure the rendering of the interface.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.OrderId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier that you received from Paynova in the response from .

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.TotalAmount
member.summary: Gets the total amount that should be processed for this payment. This must be equal to or less than the original order amount and less than the original order amount minus any payments which have been already made on the order.
member.remarks: For the majority of implementors, this will always be equal to the original amount. Lesser amounts would typically only be used in the use case where multiple payments are being made on the same order.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.PaymentChannelId
member.summary: Gets the id for the payment channel.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.PaymentMethods
member.summary: Gets the collection of payment methods to display to the customer If you do not send a value, all configured and available payment methods will be displayed.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.CustomData
member.summary: Gets the collection of private key-value data fields to store as meta-data on the transaction. This data can be viewed in Merchant Services and is returned in the GetOrder response object. We do not use this data for processing transactions.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.SessionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-to-live (TTL) of the session, in seconds, before the session times out.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.RoutingIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the name or id of the routing table to use when processing payments.
member.remarks: This field is used for advanced configurations and should only be provided if asked to do so by Paynova. Providing an invalid value in this field may result in payment failures.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.FraudScreeningProfile
member.summary: Gets or sets the name or id of the fraud screening profile (named set of fraud screening rules) to use.
member.remarks: This field is used for advanced configurations and should only be provided if asked to do so by Paynova. Providing an invalid or incorrect value in this field may result in transactions being incorrectly accepted/declined by the fraud screening provider.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.InterfaceOptions
member.summary: Used to configure the rendering of the interface.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.ProfilePaymentOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the profile payment options.

member.name: P:Paynova.Api.Client.Requests.InitializePaymentRequest.LineItems
member.summary: Gets the line items included with this payment.
member.remarks: NOT supported if the order was created as a simple order. It is highly recommended that you always send in complete line item information. Several payment methods, especially invoicing methods, require complete line information and you will not be able to use these methods if lines are not provided.

member.remarks: To maximize compatibility with existing and payment methods which are added in the future, we recommend that you always send an invoice id, regardless of the payment method used to generate the authorization

member.name: T:Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.SimpleJson.DeserializeObject(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.param: A JSON string.
member.returns: An IList<object>, a IDictionary<string,object>, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.SimpleJson.TryDeserializeObject(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Try parsing the json string into a value.
member.param: A JSON string.
The object.
member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.SimpleJson.SerializeObject(System.Object,Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.IJsonSerializerStrategy)
member.summary: Converts a IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object> object into a JSON string
member.param: A IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object>
Serializer strategy to use
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.name: M:Paynova.Api.Client.Serialization.SimpleJson.IsNumeric(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if a given object is numeric in any way (can be integer, double, null, etc).
